articles.title: Amazingly, Senate Dems work up enough nerve to condemn Trump's Binance pardon
articles.author: Karma Chameleon
articles.summary: Today President Trump pardoned Changpeng Zhao, the founder of the Binance cryptocurrency exchange, who pleaded guilty in 2023 to money laundering and served nearly four months in prison. Binance accepted the stablecoin USD1, put out by the Trump family's World Liberty Financial crypto venture, as payment for an investment in Binance made by an investment firm from Abu Dhabi. The deal enables World Liberty to keep any profits from the $2 billion investment, likely worth tens of millions of dollars a year.

articles.title: News -- Trump pardons convicted Binance co-founder Changpeng Zhao
articles.summary: Changpeng Zhao was convicted of money laundering in late 2023 as part of a $4.3 billion settlement between Binance and the Department of Justice. He was sentenced to four months in prison in 2024. President Donald Trump pardoned him on October 23, 2025. Binance was created in 2017 and quickly became the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange by volume. It agreed to suspend its US operations in a deal to resolve the criminal investigation.
